public PedestrianTileBasedMap(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer container)
Constructs a new PedestrianTileBasedMap with no obstacles, and no Pedestrians.

Parameters:
container - the GameContainer used by this map. This is used to set the number of tiles, in the map.

isDirty

public boolean isDirty()
Gets whether or not this tile map is dirty.

Returns:
true if this tile map is dirty (i.e. has changed, and needs to be saved), false otherwise.

Sets the dirty flag on this tile map.

Parameters:

getRandomOpenTile

public java.awt.Point getRandomOpenTile()
Gets a randomly chosen open tile. NOTE: If the tile map is almost completely closed, this method can take a long time to return.

Returns:
the (x, y) coordinates of a an open (non-blocked) tile.

permanentlyBlock

public boolean permanentlyBlock(int x,
                                int y)
Allows you to permanently block a given tile (i.e. add an obstacle).

Parameters:
blockX - the x-coordinate of the block you want to claim
blockY - the y-coordinate of the block you want to claim
Returns:
true if this block was already permanently blocked, false otherwise

permanentlyOpen

public boolean permanentlyOpen(int x,
                               int y)
Allows you to permanently open a given tile (i.e. to clear any obstacle).

Parameters:
blockX - the x-coordinate of the block you want to open
blockY - the y-coordinate of the block you want to open
Returns:
true if the specified block was already open, false otherwise
